professional_experience.title: Senior Full-Stack Software Developer
responsibilities: Develop and maintain the new OTA platform using Django with Python and Django REST Framework (DRF).
Integrate APIs from hotel providers like Omnibees, payment APIs like PagBank, and the consolidating airline booking API Envision.

Assist in creating and developing the new R&D area, applying agile methodologies (Scrum and Kanban), managing and prioritizing tasks for other developers, establishing development standards, applying clean code principles, and designing software architecture.
Ensure the platform's security and scalability through effective use of Django and DRF.

professional_experience.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
responsibilities: Developed cryptocurrency projects using Django REST Framework in Python, including a Proof of Concept (POC) for a BRL stablecoin for the largest bank in Latin America, in collaboration with Mercado Bitcoin and Bacen.
Worked on a Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) for Bank Indonesia in partnership with ANZ (Australia and New Zealand Banking Group). Both projects utilized the Stellar network.

Contributed to front-end development projects such as ReawardsApp, a lottery app built with React Native, and a corporate website developed using Gatsby.js, focusing on intuitive and responsive user interfaces.

Implemented agile development practices, utilizing methodologies like Scrum and Kanban, and adopted CI/CD, clean code principles, and thorough documentation to ensure code quality and maintainability.

professional_experience.title: Full-Stack Software Developer
responsibilities: Prototyped and developed IoT systems and embedded solutions, creating both hardware and software for remote monitoring and control of equipment.

Developed and maintained the ScadaBR supervisory system using Java Spring Boot (version 6), managed TCP/IP connections and HTTP protocols for webhooks, and applied it in industrial control and automation processes.
Implemented monitoring and telemetry systems using tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, and InfluxDB.
Adopted agile practices and CI/CD concepts, utilized Scrum and Kanban to ensure continuous delivery and ongoing improvement of the developed systems.

projects.description: GomuGomuu is an organization focused on building projects around the One Piece universe, creating a connected ecosystem. It includes key projects like *Merry*, a Django-based API backend that now also incorporates the functionalities of *ope-ope* for card recognition, *olop-price-scraping*, a service for tracking OPTCG exchange rates, and *nomi-nomi*, a React Native app for One Piece card identification and deck building. GomuGomuu promotes collaboration and welcomes contributions to grow and enhance its projects.

Nomi-Nomi is a React Native app that serves as an interface for the backend of Merry. It allows users to quickly identify One Piece cards by taking a photo, with the image processing handled by the backend. The app provides detailed card information and also enables users to build their own vault of cards and test deck builds. It connects seamlessly to the Merry server, offering a smooth experience for card recognition, exploration, and deck management.
